{include "default_salutation"} –

Right now, the Missouri legislature is attempting to undermine the authority of the twice-elected St. Louis Circuit Attorney, Kim Gardner.

We know this isn't about public safety. It's about targeting the first Black woman circuit attorney in the city's history and going after a politician who ran on holding police accountable.

This move is unprecedented, undemocratic, and unconstitutional.

Concurrent Jurisdiction has been roundly rejected by the bi-partisan Missouri Association of Prosecuting Attorneys as a threat to local control. No matter what corner of the state you live in, you should have a vote in who your prosecutor is. If they take power from St. Louis, any city could be next.

Now is not the time to fall for scare tactics. No prosecutor can bring charges if the police do not have a suspect, and witnesses will not come forward. That is the situation in St. Louis. Of the 193 murders committed in the city, the police have brought evidence in only 44, and of those, Circuit Attorney Gardner has brought charges in 34.

You cannot have public safety without public trust. Join us in calling the Missouri House to encourage them to preserve local control for prosecutors so that we the people can hold law enforcement accountable.

Tell your State Representative to Vote No on this unprecedented, undemocratic, and unconstitutional overreach and support Police Reform Legislation.

Call 573-282-5454.

And sign the petition to encourage the governor to convene a special session on police reform and accountability.

Sincerely,

Sara Baker
Policy Director, ACLU of {affiliate_name}
